translation: (1) By the fig and the olive[1947]
footnotes: [1947]- Referring to the places known for their production, i.e., Damascus and Jerusalem, respectively. It could also refer to the fig and olive trees or to the fruits themselves.

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِيٓ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِيمٖ
translation: (4) We have certainly created man in the best of stature;[1948]
footnotes: [1948]- i.e., upright, symmetrical, and balanced in form and nature.

translation: (5) Then We return him to the lowest of the low,[1949]
footnotes: [1949]- This can refer to the depths of Hell, to decrepit old age or to immorality.

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونٖ
translation: (6) Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
(7) So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?[1950]
footnotes: [1950]- More literally, "What makes you lie concerning it?"

translation: (8) Is not Allāh the most just of judges?
